page.title: 02Local History W. Grove
page.content: The name of Grove is thought to come from Thomas Grove, landowner of the early seventeenth century. W. Grove is almost entirely a mid twentieth century development, but there are a few historical factors directly affecting life in 1985. The G.W.R., built by Brunel, opened in August 1840. Today, Inter City trains pass through, capable of travelling at 125 m.p.h. at the rate of 44 a day. There are two railway bridges in the area. Through the southern edge also passed The Wilts. and Berkshire Canal, 1809 to 1914, now used as a footpath for walkers. From the air the ridge and furrow strip fields of Mediaeval times are still clearly visible. When enclosure came Grove became 3 farms, Grove Ham, Picked Mead and Barwell. W. Grove is built on a 1939-45 World War airfield.{
